activities.loc: Branch 2 Courtroom, 2nd Floor, Oneida County Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kristi M. Kazlausky

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on December 15, 2022 at 11:30 am.

1:32 PM Defendant Kristi M. Kazlausky in court.  Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 22CF50 & 22CF196. Court review of cases - defendant was not at last appearance - Court quashes warrants. Defendant had court dates mixed up. Schiek statement to bond. Court reinstates bonds. adj. 01:42 PM

11:40 AM Defendant Kristi M. Kazlausky does not appear.  Attorney John Paul Holevoet appeared by video for Kristi M. Kazlausky.  DA Michael Schiek in court for State of Wisconsin. Calling 22CF50, 22CF196, 22TR434, 22TR582. Holevoet noted he had tried contacting defendant prior to hearing/no response/believes counsel have reached global resolution. Court statement-authorizes warrant, will hold off signing until 10/21 at 1:15 p.m. and would then schedule for additional pretrial conference. Schiek/Holevoet - no objection. Holevoet statement-requests discovery in 22CF196 as there has been no preliminary hearing scheduled. Court statement. 11:49 a.m. adj.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.

3:01 PM Defendant Kristi M. Kazlausky in court. Attorney John Paul Holevoet appeared by video for Kristi M. Kazlausky. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 22CF50, 22CF196, 22TR343 & 22TR582. Holevoet states will make special appearance in 22CF196 - waives reading - set for preliminary hearing - time limits waived - would like to set a hearing before preliminary hearing to see if can resolve. Bail continued. 03:05 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 11:30 am.
to appear remotely - ftj/ja

2:34 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Kristi M. Kazlausky in court. Attorney John Paul Holevoet appeared by video for Kristi M. Kazlausky. Calling 22CF50, 22TR434 & 22TR582. Holevoet states has received offer - waiting on document. - would like to set out. Bond continued. adj. 02:36 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

3:05 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Kristi M. Kazlausky in court. Attorney John Paul Holevoet appeared by video for Kristi M. Kazlausky. Calling 22CF50, 22TR434 & 22TR582. Holevoet would like to set out. Bond continued. adj. 03:06 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

3:42 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Kristi M. Kazlausky in court. Attorney John Paul Holevoet in court for Kristi M. Kazlausky. records.addlTxt: State's

10:45 AM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Kristi M. Kazlausky in court.  Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Kristi M. Kazlausky. Calling 22CF50, 22TR434 & 22TR582. Magallones states Defendant wants to hire private counsel and would like to adjourn hearing. Court questions Defendant on why she waited to inform counsel. Court will proceed with preliminary hearing today - if attorney hired in future court will sign order for withdraw from Magallones. State calls Rhinelander Police Sergeant Christie Kondzela/sworn/direct by Pfeifer/witness identifies Defendant/continued direct by Pfeifer/cross by Magallones/witness is excused. State calls Oneida County Sheriff's Deputy Austin Walzinski/sworn/direct by Pfeifer/cross by Magallones/witness is excused. Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over. Court will set for arraignment. Bond continued. adj. 11:02 AM
Arraignment scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
3:17 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Kristi M. Kazlausky appeared in court. Calling 22CF50 & 22TR434. Court questions Defendant on counsel. Defendant states does not have funding for counsel - applied to PD's office and is eligible. Court states letter was received from Defendant on citation - citation is converted to this case. Defendant states has received notice of intent to revocate license. Court questions Schiek on refusal - no matter was filed. Schiek does not have answer - will question staff. Court in recess 03:22 PM Back on record 03:46 PM. Parties remain same along with Attorney Breanna Magallones - Defendant is eligible and will be appointed. In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing - time limits waived. Bail continued. adj. 03:48 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Letter from Defendant re: hearing
No taverns except for work purposes only/all other conditions remain

1:09 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Kristi M. Kazlausky appeared in court. Court review of case. Court questions Defendant on counsel. Defendant states she is still trying to find counsel. Court will set out. Defendant statement to bond. Court amends bond conditions.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
protective

No abusive contact with M.E.C./No intoxicants/No taverns/No possession or use of prescription medications or controlled substances without valid prescription and ONLY in dosage - manner as prescribed - Must be in the prescription bottle it came in.

1:56 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Kristi M. Kazlausky appeared by video, in custody. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Schiek statement to bail. Defendant statement to charges/bond. Court sets bond. adj. 02:05 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 25, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
